Temporal delay and signal decay are generally present in leaky 
integrator =
neurons, a.k.a. Continuous Time Recurrent Neural Networks 
(CTRNNs).  Tyler=
 Street wrote a version of leaky-NEAT that implements 
this type of neural =
network, and I believe Peter's current HyperNEAT 
code also implements leak=
y integrators in the neural substrate.  So 
this type of thing has been com=
bined with NEAT already to some extent.

Of course, there are possibly othe=
r ways to implement these concepts 
aside from CTRNNs, and you may have an =
alternative idea in mind, so 
it doesn't mean that your idea has already be=
en implemented- just 
that related ideas are out there. 

I'm also not sure=
 what kind of neuron is in bug brain (thanks for the 
link), so that may be=
 another alternative.

ken
